newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Regent says no immediate plan on Hambros.
newsitem.headline: Regent says no immediate plan on Hambros.

text.p: Hong Kong-based global emerging markets investment house Regent Pacific Group Ltd said on Friday it had no immediate plans to buy more shares in Hambros Plc.
"There are no specific plans at present for the company to increase its interest in Hambros, which is one of several investments held by the company," it said in a statement.
Regent Pacific said it made the statement in response to press reports that it had not ruled out increasing its four percent stake in the British merchant bank.

"However, the company reserves the right to review its corporate investment portfolio on an ongoing basis. Since the company's existing investment in Hambros is significant, the directors shall be paying close and continuing attention to the performance of Hambros," it said.
Regent Pacific said details would be disclosed through the appropriate channels if it decided to buy more Hambros shares.
"The directors stress that any such acquisition will not be funded out of the proceeds of the share offer," it added.
Regent Pacific offered 170.5 million shares at HK$2.62 each, raising about HK$447 million. Dealing in the shares is expected to begin on May 19.
